item.title: The Casbah: A Wild Ride Through Vintage Las Vegas History
item.description:
A Desert Oasis: The Casbah’s Early Years

The mid-1960s Las Vegas Strip was a landscape of rapid change and a blurring of legal and ethical lines. In 1963, developer Danny Jackson, aiming to capture the exotic allure of the Middle East, opened the Casbah Hotel and Casino. Its design, intended to evoke a Moroccan palace with opulent carpets, shimmering fountains, and distinctive architecture, was a bold statement in a Vegas still defining itself. The Casbah quickly became a popular spot, attracting a clientele seeking entertainment and a looser atmosphere than some of the more established Strip resorts.
